visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a column chart. The chart should have a title 'SEO has increased B2B sales by 30% in Aug'. The x-axis should display categories 'May', 'June', 'July', 'Aug'. The y-axis should have labels formatted as '{value}k $'. The chart should display a single series named 'Sales' with data [206, 216, 247, 330]. The chart should have a white background and a legend positioned at the bottom.

title.text: SEO has increased B2B sales by 30% in Aug

visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object configures a column chart with specific settings. The chart type is set to 'column', and it has a white background. The title of the chart is 'SEO has increased B2B sales by 30% in Aug'. The x-axis displays categories 'May', 'June', 'July', 'Aug' with labels styled in a dark gray color and a font size of 14px. The y-axis labels are formatted to show values in thousands of dollars ('{value}k $') and are also styled with a dark gray color and a font size of 14px. The chart includes one series named 'Sales' with data points [206, 216, 247, 330], and the series color is set to green (#008000). Additionally, the legend is positioned at the bottom of the chart, centered horizontally.
